title: January 6th Committee Exposes "Big Rip-Off" - $250 Million Fraudulent Fundraising Scheme
summary: House January 6th Committee's second hearing revealed Trump raised $250 million post-election through fraudulent "Official Election Defense Fund" that never existed. Committee found Trump's team sent up to 25 fraudulent fundraising emails daily, raising $100 million in first week after election loss. Only small fraction went to election challenges; most funded Trump's Save America PAC, paid campaign debts, and enriched Trump properties. Committee member Zoe Lofgren stated "The Big Lie was also a big rip-off."

sources.title: Jan. 6 panel finds Trump campaign knew election fraud claims were false but raised $250 million from it anyway
Trump raised $250 million to fight election fraud claims. Here's where that money went
Jan. 6 committee says Trump engaged in "Big Rip-Off" by fundraising off election lies

notes: Committee investigator Amanda Wick testified that despite claims, the "Official Election Defense Fund" was a marketing tactic that never existed as a formal fund. Money went to Trump's Save America PAC and affiliated entities instead of election challenges.
